text: Jews Still Have an Advantage
Therefore, what \add is\add* the advantage of the Jew, or what \add is\add* the use of circumcision?
Much in every way. For first, that they were entrusted with the oracles of God.
⸤What is the result⸥\f + \fr 3:3 \ft Literally “for what” \f* if some refused to believe? Their unbelief will not nullify the faithfulness of God, \add will it\add*?
May it never be! But let God be true but every human being a liar, just as it is written,
“In order that you may be justified in your words,
and may prevail when you are\ef + \fr 3:4 \ft ﻿*Or, if the form is understood as middle voice, “when you yourself judge” \ef* judged.”\f + \fr 3:4 \ft A quotation from \xt Ps 51:4 \ft \f*

But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God, what shall we say? God, who inflicts wrath, \add is\add* not unjust, \add is he\add*? (I am speaking according to a human perspective.)
May it never be! For otherwise, how will God judge the world?
But if by my lying, the truth of God abounded to his glory, why am I also still condemned as a sinner?

And \add why\add* not (as we are slandered, and as some affirm that we say), “Let us do evil, in order that good may come \add of it\add*? Their\f + \fr 3:8 \ft Literally “whose” \f* condemnation is just!
The Entire World Guilty of Sin
What then? Do we have an advantage? Not at all. For we have already charged both Jews and Greeks are all under sin,
just as it is written,
“\add There\add* is no one righteous, not even one;
\add there\add* is no one who understands;
\add there\add* is no one who seeks God.
All have turned aside together; they have become worthless;
\add There\add* is no one who practices kindness;
\add there\add* is not even one.\f + \fr 3:12 \ft Verses \xt 10–12 \ft are a quotation from \xt Ps 14:1–3 \ft \f*
Their throat \add is\add* an opened grave;
they deceive with their tongues;
the venom of asps \add is\add* under their lips,\f + \fr 3:13 \ft A quotation from \xt Ps 5:9 \ft and \xt Ps 140:3 \ft \f*
whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.\f + \fr 3:14 \ft A quotation from \xt Ps 10:7 \ft \f*
Their feet \add are\add* swift to shed blood;
destruction and distress \add are\add* in their paths,
and they have not known the way of peace.\f + \fr 3:17 \ft Verses \xt 15–17 \ft are a quotation from \xt Isa 59:7–8 \ft \f*
The fear of God is not before their eyes.”\f + \fr 3:18 \ft A quotation from \xt Ps 36:1 \ft \f*
Now we know that whatever the law says, it speaks to those under the law, in order that every mouth may be closed and the whole world may become accountable to God.

For by the works of the law ⸤no person will be declared righteous⸥\f + \fr 3:20 \ft Literally “all flesh will not be declared righteous” \f* before him, for through the law \add comes\add* knowledge of sin.
Righteousness through Faith Revealed
But now, apart from the law, the righteousness of God has been revealed, being testified about by the law and the prophets—
that is, the righteousness of God through faith in Jesus Christ\f + \fr 3:22 \ft Or “through the faithfulness of Jesus Christ” \f* to all who believe. For \add there\add* is no distinction,
for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,
being justified as a gift by his grace, through the redemption which is in Christ Jesus,

whom God made publicly available as the mercy seat\f + \fr 3:25 \ft Or “as the place of propitiation” \f* through faith in his blood, for a demonstration of his righteousness, because of the passing over of previously committed sins,

in the forbearance of God, for the demonstration of his righteousness in the present time, so that he should be just and the one who justifies the \add person\add* by faith\f + \fr 3:26 \ft Or “by Jesus’ faithfulness” \f* in Jesus.
Therefore, where \add is\add* boasting? It has been excluded. By what kind of law? Of works? No, but by a law\f + \fr 3:27 \ft Or “a principle” \f* of faith.
For we consider a person to be justified by faith apart from the works of the law.
Or \add is God\add* the God of the Jews only? \add Is he\add* not also \add the God\add* of the Gentiles? Yes, also of the Gentiles,

since God \add is\add* one, who will justify ⸤those who are circumcised⸥\f + \fr 3:30 \ft Literally “circumcision” \f* by faith and ⸤those who are uncircumcised⸥\f + \fr 3:30 \ft Literally “uncircumcision” \f* through faith.
Therefore, do we nullify the law through faith? May it never be! But we uphold the law.
